title: Notes by the Way; or, what I saw in my rambles
author: Higginson, H. Talbot.
snippet: Further onwe come to Leicester Square, purchased by the notorious Albert orBaron Grant, and presented by him to the Metropolitan Board ofWorks for the enjoyment of the public. On the east side of the squareis the Alhambra Theatre, once the Panopticon of Science and Art, andafterwards a circus, where I saw the great Leotard perform on the trapeze. It is now the noted place for ballets and pantomimes.
